IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified poles that need replacing and upgrading. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate that some customers have been impacted by multiple unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the poles. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our engineers will be carrying out preparation works prior to the power cut on the 12th November 2025. This work is taking place near Plash Road and Park Road. A road closure will be in place to allow the work to be carried out safely. Access to your property will always be provided.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified 6 cables and 6 poles that need replacing and upgrading. We will also be installing 3 new electricity poles. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the equipment. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors Avidety may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. Avidety will need access to the inside of your property to conduct safety checks in the morning before we switch off the power and we will need to do another check when we turn the power back on. This work is taking place on South Avenue.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced multiple unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Hall Lane.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Lowestoft Road.

Steps.Message: Good morning, this is a message from Harry at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut which is currently in progress today the 13th November 2025 in the TN25 postcode area. The power was switched off to enable our contractors to test a piece of equipment called a transformer to ensure that it is functioning properly. Our contractors have advised us that the 42 affected properties will be restored early between approximately 10:25 and 10:45. This is due to better accessibility on site meaning that the works are progressing well and being completed ahead of schedule. Once these works are complete this will improve the reliability of the electricity network. Our reference number for this work is INCD-326716-U. I hope that the power coming on earlier is of benefit to you. We always aim to provide a 10/10 service, if you feel we have not delivered you a 10/10 service then please call us on 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified an electricity pole that needs replacing and upgrading. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced an unplanned power cut in the last 6 months. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the pole. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors Avidety may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. This work is taking place on Hanscombe End Road. Two way traffic lights will be in place to allow the work to be carried out safely. Access to your property will always be provided.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified a piece of equipment called a transformer that needs replacing and upgrading. Once completed this work will improve the reliability of the electricity network and help to provide additional capacity for new low carbon technologies such as heat pumps and electric vehicle chargers. Doing this will also reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate that some customers have been affected by multiple unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off and upgrade the transformer. We will remove the existing one and install a new one on the same day. This work is taking place near Palehouse Common.

This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

Sent by Bailey at 09:11 - We can now confirm that all power in the Chelsea embankment, SW3 4  area should now be back on. 

We know there was another power cut recently, but following tests made by our engineers they have advised the issues are unrelated, so we don't currently expect this to affect your power again.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the recent outages. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on. If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 23:45 - We can now confirm that all power in the Hersham Road should be back on. The issue was due to a fault on our underground network, however engineers have managed to restore power from the substation nearby and will be investigating the root cause.

If there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Simon at 22:45 - Thanks for bearing with us over today, I just wanted to give you the latest from our engineers. Our staff have now confirmed that our substation equipment has operated due to an underground cable fault which we'll need to pinpoint, excavate and repair. We have further specialist teams and equipment on site, and it's possible they will still be able to restore your power within the current time frame using other methods. However, once they've assessed further we'll let you know if the time frame needs to change. For more information about this type of fault; here's a short video https://bit.ly/2ScxQDZ - I'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 20:42 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 10:16 - We can now confirm that all power in the Station Road area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by Kevin at 09:54
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have now arrived on site in the Station Road area.

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Our estimated time frame of between 11:30 and 12:30 hasn't changed, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed. This can involve ground excavations, traffic management equipment or specialist teams. As soon as our staff can safely update us, we'll give you the latest news. Sent by Kevin at 09:11.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section.
